content.title: Left-Sided Inferior Vena Cava
content.description: Congenital venous anomaly with IVC located to the left of the aorta, resulting from right supracardinal vein regression.

clinical_features.course: Crosses to right at level of renal veins to join normal suprahepatic IVC

clinical_implications.surgical_planning: Important for retroperitoneal surgery, left nephrectomy
clinical_implications.lumbar_spine_surgery: Risk of injury if not recognized

content.clinical_pearl: Always review CT for venous anomalies before retroperitoneal surgery; left IVC crosses near left renal vein level
